description:
when using nova command to list the server. it fails to list the server. 
I had observer from the debug log , when its trying to make the connection to api its not using projectid when --version is 1.1.
Its creating bad request when trying to connect nova api

Log:



nova --debug  --username root --apikey rajesh--projectid Administrator --url http://localhost:5000/v2.0 --version 1.0 list
connect: (localhost, 5000)
send: 'POST /tokens HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: localhost:5000\r\nContent-Length: 108\r\ncontent-type: application/json\r\naccept-encoding: gzip, deflate\r\nuser-agent: python-novaclient\r\n\r\n{"auth": {"tenantName": "Administrator", "passwordCredentials": {"username": "root", "password": "rajesh"}}}'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n'
header: Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
header: Content-Length: 1015
header: Date: Mon, 21 Nov 2011 18:22:35 GMT
connect: (localhost, 8774)
send: u'GET /v1.1//servers/detail?fresh=1321899755.99 HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: localhost:8774\r\nx-auth-project-id: Administrator\r\nx-auth-token: 999888777666\r\naccept-encoding: gzip, deflate\r\nuser-agent: python-novaclient\r\n\r\n'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found\r\n'
header: Content-Length: 52
header: Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
header: Date: Mon, 21 Nov 2011 18:22:36 GMT
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/nova", line 9, in <module>
    load_entry_point('python-novaclient==2.6.8', 'console_scripts', 'nova')()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/shell.py", line 247, in main
    OpenStackComputeShell().main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/shell.py", line 210, in main
    args.func(self.cs, args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/v1_0/shell.py", line 520, in do_list
    utils.print_list(cs.servers.list(search_opts=search_opts),
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/v1_0/servers.py", line 250, in list
    return self._list("/servers%s%s" % (detail, query_string), "servers")
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/base.py", line 66, in _list
    resp, body = self.api.client.get(url)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/client.py", line 134, in get
    return self._cs_request(url, 'GET', **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/client.py", line 121, in _cs_request
    **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/client.py", line 104, in request
    raise exceptions.from_response(resp, body)
novaclient.exceptions.NotFound: n/a (HTTP 404)
title: nova command is not working as expected

comments.content:
when using nova command to list the server. it fails to list the server. 
I had observer from the debug log , when its trying to make the connection to api its not using projectid when --version is 1.1.
Its creating bad request when trying to connect nova api

Log:



nova --debug  --username root --apikey rajesh--projectid Administrator --url http://localhost:5000/v2.0 --version 1.0 list
connect: (localhost, 5000)
send: 'POST /tokens HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: localhost:5000\r\nContent-Length: 108\r\ncontent-type: application/json\r\naccept-encoding: gzip, deflate\r\nuser-agent: python-novaclient\r\n\r\n{"auth": {"tenantName": "Administrator", "passwordCredentials": {"username": "root", "password": "rajesh"}}}'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n'
header: Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
header: Content-Length: 1015
header: Date: Mon, 21 Nov 2011 18:22:35 GMT
connect: (localhost, 8774)
send: u'GET /v1.1//servers/detail?fresh=1321899755.99 HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: localhost:8774\r\nx-auth-project-id: Administrator\r\nx-auth-token: 999888777666\r\naccept-encoding: gzip, deflate\r\nuser-agent: python-novaclient\r\n\r\n'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found\r\n'
header: Content-Length: 52
header: Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
header: Date: Mon, 21 Nov 2011 18:22:36 GMT
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/nova", line 9, in <module>
    load_entry_point('python-novaclient==2.6.8', 'console_scripts', 'nova')()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/shell.py", line 247, in main
    OpenStackComputeShell().main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/shell.py", line 210, in main
    args.func(self.cs, args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/v1_0/shell.py", line 520, in do_list
    utils.print_list(cs.servers.list(search_opts=search_opts),
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/v1_0/servers.py", line 250, in list
    return self._list("/servers%s%s" % (detail, query_string), "servers")
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/base.py", line 66, in _list
    resp, body = self.api.client.get(url)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/client.py", line 134, in get
    return self._cs_request(url, 'GET', **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/client.py", line 121, in _cs_request
    **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/python_novaclient-2.6.8-py2.7.egg/novaclient/client.py", line 104, in request
    raise exceptions.from_response(resp, body)
novaclient.exceptions.NotFound: n/a (HTTP 404)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rajesh-battala

comments.content:
Two things jump out at me:
1) your keystone endpoint isn't returning an auth token
2) you are using version 1.0 of the compute api, when we only support 2 (or 1.1) in master

Can you please make sure you are using the correct urls/versions and maybe get some more logging from the servers for us?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content: We cannot solve the issue you reported without more information. Could you please provide the requested information ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: This bug lacks the necessary information to effectively reproduce and fix it, therefore it has been closed. Feel free to reopen the bug by providing the requested information and set the bug status back to ''New''.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
